Powershell & SVN – Export files to CSV

Published: April 15, 2013

Function Get-SvnLogData() { ([xml](svn log -v –xml ‘http://svn/trunk’)).log.logentry | % { $nestedEntry = $_ $_.paths.path | % { $path = $_ $nestedEntry | Select-Object -Property ` Author, ` @{n=’Revision’; e={([int]$_.Revision)}}, ` @{n=’Date’; e={Get-Date $_.Date }}, ` @{n=’Action’; e={$path.action }}, ` @{n=’Path’; e={$path.InnerText }}` } } }

Get-SvnLogData | where { $_.Date -ge (Get-Date ‘16-04-2013’) } | Select-Object Revision,Date,Path,Author | sort -property ` @{ Expression=”Path”; Descending=$false }, ` @{ Expression=”Revision”; Descending=$true } | Export-CSV c:\test.csv
